original: @202b # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @202b # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: sha ta bhu ja ku ru kulle s'a dha nam /
analyzed: sha ta bhu ja ku ru kulle s'a dha nam /
translated: Ṣaḍbhujakurukullāsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rigs byed ma phyag drug ma'i sgrub thabs //
analyzed: rigs byed ma phyag drug ma'i sgrub thabs //
translated: Rig byed ma phyag drug ma’i sgrub thabs

original: ku ru kulle la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ku ru kulle la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Kurukullā.

original: dang por sngags pas stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
analyzed: dang por sngags pas stan bde ba la 'dug ste /
translated: First, the mantrin should sit on a comfortable seat,

original: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bcom ldan 'das ma dang sangs rgyas @203a * //
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bcom ldan 'das ma dang sangs rgyas @203a * //
translated: and with the light rays of the seed syllable in his heart, he should invite the Blessed Lady, the Buddhas,

original: dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams gdan drangs nas mchod pa dang / skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams gdan drangs nas mchod pa dang / skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: and the Bodhisattvas, and make offerings and go for refuge, and so forth.

original: de nas stong pa nyid du mos pa bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid du mos pa bya zhing /
translated: Then he should imagine emptiness,

original: sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: and bless it with the mantra.

original: aom yig las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ram yig 'od zer gyi phreng ba dang bcas pa rnam par bsam zhing de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma rigs byed ma blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom yig las byung ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ram yig 'od zer gyi phreng ba dang bcas pa rnam par bsam zhing de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma rigs byed ma blta bar bya'o //
translated: He should imagine an Oṃ syllable from which arises a moon maṇḍala with a raṃ syllable and a garland of light rays. From its complete transformation, he should see the Blessed Lady Kurukullā.

original: padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa dang nyi ma'i gdan la rdo rje skyil krung gis nye bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa dang nyi ma'i gdan la rdo rje skyil krung gis nye bar bzhugs pa /
translated: He sits in vajra posture on a seat of a red lotus with eight petals and a sun,

original: phyag drug pa /
analyzed: phyag drug pa /
translated: with six arms.

original: g-yas dang g-yon gyi phyag dang po gnyis kyis 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon gyi phyag dang po gnyis kyis 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya 'dzin pa /
translated: The first pair of right and left hands hold the gesture of victory over the three worlds.

original: gnyis pa'i g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa dag gis lcags kyu dang / autpal la dmar po bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i g-yas pa dang / g-yon pa dag gis lcags kyu dang / autpal la dmar po bsnams pa'o //
translated: The second right and left hands hold a goad and a red utpala.

original: phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis mda' dang gzhu rna ba'i rtsar 'gengs pa /
analyzed: phyag lhag ma gnyis kyis mda' dang gzhu rna ba'i rtsar 'gengs pa /
translated: The remaining two hands hold a bow and arrow drawn to the ear.

original: na bza' dmar po mnabs pa /
analyzed: na bza' dmar po mnabs pa /
translated: He wears red garments.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas dbu brgyan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lngas dbu brgyan pa /
translated: He is crowned with the five Tathagatas.

original: bsgrub bya'i snying gar autpal dmar po'i ze'u 'bru la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ram yig kha dog dmar po rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i snying gar autpal dmar po'i ze'u 'bru la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ram yig kha dog dmar po rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: At the heart of the one to be accomplished, on the anthers of a red utpala flower, on a moon mandala, visualize a red RAM syllable.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas shing de'i snying gar lcags kyus phug ste bkug nas snying gar zhugs shing autpal dmar po'i mde'u can gyi mdas bsgrub bya yang nas yang du 'gugs shing sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas shing de'i snying gar lcags kyus phug ste bkug nas snying gar zhugs shing autpal dmar po'i mde'u can gyi mdas bsgrub bya yang nas yang du 'gugs shing sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Standing on the wind maṇḍala, one should summon the target by piercing his heart with a hook, and having entered his heart, one should repeatedly summon the target with an arrow having a red lotus head, and recite the mantra.

original: de la yang sngags 'di'o //
analyzed: de la yang sngags 'di'o //
translated: And the mantra is this:

original: aom ku ru kulle hr'i:che ge mo bdag gi dbang du gyis shig ho:sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ku ru kulle hr'i:che ge mo bdag gi dbang du gyis shig ho:sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ kuru ku llē hriḥ, bring such-and-such under my control, hoḥ, svāhā.

original: de nas de la bsgrub bya mos pa'i dbang du byas nas rkang pa'i drung du lhung bar blta zhing bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de la bsgrub bya mos pa'i dbang du byas nas rkang pa'i drung du lhung bar blta zhing bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should imagine the target falling at one’s feet, and one should look at him and exhort him.

original: de lta bsu brgya byin yang dbang du byed do //
analyzed: de lta bsu brgya byin yang dbang du byed do //
translated: In this way, one can even bring Śakra under one’s control.

original: ges byed ma phyag drug ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: ges byed ma phyag drug ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of Kurukullā with six arms is complete.
